node.title: Jazz musician Jon Batiste leads expanded field of Grammy nominations
node.alt: Six men and women, all nominated for Grammy awards, performing
node.description: Jazz musician Jon Batiste leads nominations at the 63rd AnnualÂ Grammy Awards in Los Angeles with 11 nods, followed by Justin Bieber, Doja Cat and H.E.R with eight apiece.
node.content:
["Jazz musician Jon Batiste has led nominations at the Grammy Awards with 11 nods, followed by Justin Bieber, Doja Cat and H.E.R with eight apiece.", "Batiste and Bieber will compete for the top prize \u2014 album of the year \u2014 alongside a long list of talent including:", "The Grammys, which are the highest honours in the music industry, will be awarded\u00a0at a ceremony in Los Angeles on January 31.", "Nominees in the top three categories \u2014 album, song and record of the year \u2014 were increased from 8 to 10 for the first time.", "Recording Academy chief executive Harvey Mason Jr said expanding the number of nominees helps to \"cast\u00a0a wider net for more music, more artists and more genres.\"", "Eilish, Rodrigo, Bieber and Batiste were also among the 10 nominees for record of the year, along with ABBA's new comeback single, I Still Have Faith in You.", "But Swift, who snagged a best album nod for Evermore, was shut out of both the record of the year and song of the year contests.", "Eighteen-year-old phenomenon Rodrigo burst onto the US charts in January when her single\u00a0Drivers License went viral.", "The teen received seven nods, including best new artist and for her debut album, Sour.", "", "
Teen sensation Olivia Rodrigo has received seven Grammy nominations.\u00a0(AP: Charles Sykes/Invision/AP, File)
", "Batiste, who also leads the band on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, scored nominations across the board, ranging from his music video Freedom to his album We Are, which was inspired by the Black Lives Matter protests of 2020.", "The Recording Academy who organise the Grammy Awards changed the way nominations and winners are chosen earlier this year, after persistent allegations the process was open to rigging.", "Last year, the Academy was slammed when Canadian artist The Weeknd received zero nominations despite releasing After Hours, one of the most critically acclaimed albums of 2020.\u00a0", "This year's nominations\u00a0were selected by all 11,000 voting members of the Recording Academy, instead of smaller committees of industry experts whose names were not revealed.", "Winners are also chosen by the musicians, producers and songwriters who are members of the Recording Academy. \u00a0", "", "
Universal Music will welcome BTS to their roster following their split from\u00a0Sony.(Reuters:\u00a0Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo)
", "The South Korean boy band, BTS, got a nod for their performance of their top-selling single Butter in the pop group field but missed out in other major categories.", "Despite\u00a0dominating the US\u00a0music charts for almost two years, the group is yet to win a Grammy.\u00a0", "Gaga and Bennett, 95,\u00a0who has Alzheimer's disease, received multiple nods for their American standards duets album, Love for Sale.\u00a0", "The eligibility period for the Grammys ran from September 2020 to September 2021, meaning Adele's new album, 30, will have to wait until next time.", "Here is a list of nominations in key categories. Read the full list here.\u00a0", "
Album of the year
", "
Record of the year
", "
Song of the year
", "
Best new artist
", "
Best pop duo / group performance
", "

", "

", "

", "

", "

", "ABC/Reuters"]
